alert.note: Alert for Lincoln (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 03 at 7:28PM MDT until August 03 at 8:30PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR CENTRAL LINCOLN COUNTY... At 728 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Up to 1.10 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.25 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Excessive rainfall over the burn scar will impact Nogal Canyon Burn Scar and the Nogal Arroyo. The debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Nogal and Nogal Canyon. This includes the following highways... Highway 380 between Mile Markers 71 and 76. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Never cross flooded roads. Most flash flood deaths occur in automobiles. Arroyos, streams, and normally dry rivers can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes. Water in arroyos can travel many miles and take hours to reach your location from upstream rain areas.
